column2: Claim: More than 19 crore people have been insured against life and accident risk or ensured pension.
column5: Fact: 5.3 crore people under PMJJBY, 13.5 crore under PMSBY and 1.08 crore people under APY have been covered. Hence, the claim is TRUE.
column10: Fact Checking Government claims on Jan Suraksha

column2: Claim: Acid attack victims have been included in the list of people considered as disabled.
column5: Fact: Under the new act, acid attack victims are considered physically disabled. Hence the claim is TRUE. It should also be noted that ‘acid attack victims’ as a category was not included in the original bill introduced by the UPA.
column10: Fact Checking Government Claims on the ‘Rights of Persons with Disabilities Act’

column2: Fake News Alert: AICTE has not issued any Circular scrapping the 75% Attendance rule for Engineering
column10: Fake News Alert: AICTE has not issued any Circular scrapping the 75% Attendance rule for Engineering

column2: Fact Check: Was the Winter Session of Parliament postponed during UPA rule?
column10: Fact Check: Was the Winter Session of Parliament postponed during UPA rule?

column2: Fact Check: Are more people travelling in Airplanes than in AC trains?
column5: Fact: While it is true that the National Civil Aviation Policy was unveiled in 2016, it is not clear what the government meant by transformation of the sector. Hence the claim is UNVERIFIED.
column10: Fact Check: Are more people travelling in Airplanes than in AC trains?

column2: Claim: All 34 international airports and all 48 domestic airports have been provided with accessible feature.
column5: Fact: All 34 International Airports & 48 Domestic Airports, have been provided with accessibility features. The infographic says all 48 domestic airports, but the number of domestic airports in India is more than 48. Hence, the claim is PARTLY TRUE.
column10: Fact Checking Government Claims on Accessibility for Persons with Disabilities (PwDs)

column2: Claim: More than 1.26 crore Sukanya Samriddhi accounts have been opened for the girl child with over 19,183 crores deposited and that financial future has been secured for crores of girls.
column5: Fact: As on 30th June 2018, 1,39,85,442 accounts have been opened under SSY and a total amount of Rs 25979.62 crore  has been deposited. The numbers are higher than the claim because of the dynamic nature of the scheme. Hence, this claim is TRUE. But the claim that financial future has been secured for crores of girls is FALSE since only 1.39 crore accounts have been opened under the SSY and this is less than 15% of the total female population in the 0-10 age group as per the 2011 census.
column10: Fact Checking Government claims on ‘Welfare of the Girl Child’
